info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:51PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR GLASSCOCK...NORTHEASTERN MIDLAND...SOUTHEASTERN MARTIN AND SOUTHERN HOWARD COUNTIES... At 550 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stanton to 8 miles southeast of Greenwood to 12 miles southeast of Midland, moving southeast at 40 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR EASTERN MIDLAND, GREENWOOD, STANTON, AND SPRARBERRY. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Midland, Greenwood, Garden City, Stanton, Forsan, Lomax, Courtney, Cotton Flat, Elbow, Stanton Municipal Aiport and Spraberry. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 141 and 166. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
